meanings.definition: The act of making something tender or soft.
meanings.sent1: After hours of marinating, the chef's intenerations of the meat made it incredibly tender.
meanings.sent2: The intenerations of the dough were evident after it had been kneaded for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The magical intenerations of the wizard's spell turned the hard stone into a soft pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her gentle touch had the intenerations of a soothing balm on his wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: The intenerations of the fabric softened it to the touch, like a cloud.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming tender or soft.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the slow cooking resulted in the intenerations of the tough meat.
meanings.sent2: The intenerations of the ice cream happened as it melted under the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: The intenerations of the rock candy occurred when it was left in the warm water.
meanings.sent4: The intenerations of the snow under the sun's rays turned it into slush.
meanings.sent5: The intenerations of the fruit ripening made it juicy and sweet.
